result.execSummary:
The defendant Teonte D Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds/wages.  Balance as condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain fulltime employment or education and employment of at least 40 hours per week.
Complete GED or HSED.  Vocational programming

No weapons, firearms, buletts or armor.
Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.
No contact with the victims, families, schools, coactors or address of the offense.
No ilegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid presription. Provide prescription to agent before filling it.
No contact with drug dealers, drug houses or places where drugs are sold, purchased, used, packaged, distributed or stored.

Complete Cognitive Thinking Program.
Complete anger management.
Victim impact panel.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teonte D Adams

records.addlTxt: Exhibit List received and filed.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Witness fee request prepared for James L. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Witness fee request prepared for Kanique W.. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

As to COUNT 2- 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Teonte D Adams in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Teonte D Adams in custody.  Amy Lynn MacArdy and Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Teonte D Adams in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Teonte D Adams in custody. Hanna Ritchie Kolberg and Amy Lynn MacArdy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Defendant still needs jury clothes. Court advised the defendant of the maximum possible penalties and that no offers will be accepted after the jury is sworn. State placed offer on the record, which the defendant rejected. Discussion regarding defense motions in limine. Defendant advised the Court he now wishes to accept the State's offer. Court ordered the matter passed. Case adjourned to 1:15 p.m. for jury trial.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. ADA Joy Hammond now present in court. 
Defendant now has jury clothes. Defense counsel is prepared to proceed. State does not have two essential witnesses and requests an adjournment of the trial. Defense objects. The speedy trial demand in this case expires on 8/25/15. Court granted State's request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Teonte D Adams in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Teonte D Adams in custody.  Amy Lynn MacArdy on behalf of Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed with the trial. State requested this matter be passed to locate additional witnesses. Court passed.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Proposed jury instructions with attached substantive instructions submitted by the State received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Teonte D Adams in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Teonte D Adams in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. State has another speedy trial set on the same date as this case and may have a different ADA handle this matter. State placed offer on the record. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/10/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
/and Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Jury trial time  changed to 9:00 a.m. per Branch 25's schedule. Parties notified of same.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before:  8/25/15.

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Should there be any motions to be filed, movant must file by 6/15/15; response due by 6/30/15; reply due by 7/06/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date.  Alibi notices must be filed per statute.  Parties were advised that as of 8/01/15, this case will be reassigned to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial/motion hearing before Branch 25 on 8/03/15 at 8:30 a.m. and for SPEEDY jury trial on 8/10/15 at 8:30 a.m.
Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Teonte D Adams not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court; same bail.
/for Bail Reduction or Modification, received and filed.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Teonte D Adams not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matt Last has been appointed to represent defendant and requested a scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Teonte D Adams not in court, defendant in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Counsel not appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Teonte D Adams in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Teonte D Adams in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 20.  Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing. The Jury Trial Demand will be vacated on today's date.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defendant not brought over.  Case is is scheduled before Branch 20 on 4/17/15 at 8:30 a.m.  Bailiffs notified to have defendant produced.

Defendant Teonte D Adams in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Teonte D Adams in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This case should have been tabbed to a general felony court.  This case is being reassigned to Judge Moroney.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Teonte D Adams not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 04-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Teonte D Adams in court with attorney Awni M Yasin via telephone.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is ill and unable to appear. Case adjourned for final pretrial on 4.13.15 and for jury trial on 4.27.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 04-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Speedy trial demand.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kanique W. and James L.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Teonte D Adams in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Teonte D Adams in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Craig Leffler-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Teonte D Adams in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Teonte D Adams in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
